=

What is Platinum like or Iridium or the Iridium Platinum mix?=A0 Just wond=
ering.
=A0

In a message dated 5/27/2009 10:53:50 A.M. Eastern Daylight Tim=
e, w9sz.zack@gmail. com writes:







Silver is the best conductor known, =
with a conductivity of 63.01 E06 Siemens per meter. Copper is next best at =
59.6 E06 S/m. Gold is not the best, at 45.2 E06 S/m. Aluminum is much farth=
er down, at 37.8 E06 S/m.
=A0
Silver and gold are expensive.=A0They are usu=
ally used to plate RF assemblies where the skin effect takes=A0place (curre=
nt doesn't flow uniformly through a conductor at RF frequencies but mainly =
travels=A0at the surface of the conductor).=A0Gold has the advantage that i=
t never tarnishes or corrodes with most things it is exposed to. It's used =
a lot in contacts for rotary switches and relays.
=A0
Zack


On Wed, May 27=
, 2009 at 9:38 AM, Golden Phoenix <golden_phoenix42@ yahoo.com> wrote:




=









Firrst Electrical job I was on as a helper in 1976 was to pick up =
a pole that was to feeding a house someone had wired in aluminum that had b=
urned to the ground due to a bad connection it had just been built. I had b=
een with my old man on a many job sinhce I was 8 and never had seen anythin=
g like that. Copper is the only way to gold only better conductor is Gold. =
but who can handle that in a house. worste case of emf I have ever seen was=
 a fancy chandaler that someone had over sized bulbs in and that thing flar=
ed up the whole house to very dangerous levels. when they say 60 watt max t=
hey mean it for your own safety. this thing had around 10 100 watt bulbs in=
 it and the emfs were causing all kinds of nice images after 30 minutes in =
the house we were having them too. 


=A0

copper is a great conductor
=A0


In a=
 message dated 5/27/2009 9:44:02 A.M. Eastern Daylight Time, w9sz.zack@gmai=
l. com writes:








Aluminum wire is a nightmare! The stuff tends to=A0o=
verheat, oxidizes where interconnections are made and=A0will spark, etc. 
=
=A0
I bought a transformer at Gateway Electronics in St. Louis=A0some years=
 ago that looked like a great transformer for a high-current 12 volt supply=
. The secondary appeared to be wound with #8 enameled wire. I found out the=
 secondary was wound with aluminum wire.=A0After I built the power supply a=
nd tried to get 20 amps from it but couldn't, I gave up on it and got anoth=
er transformer wound with copper wire.

Zack

=A0

On Wed, May 27, 2009 at =
8:16 AM, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@ gmail.com> wrote:










=A0We=
 have a touch lamp that comes on by itself, and we have electric matress he=
aters that make a clicking noise in the radio when the controller is on. Wh=
en the furnace comes on, it affects the boxes, and--when=A0I first started =
doign EVP recordings with white noise, if the=A0furnace happened to come on=
 when I was recording a voice would report "it's on fire!".
=A0
=A0What if =
that house has aluminum wire?
=A0
=A0Frank-S

Also with flakey tra=
nsformers or other power distribution in the area, or power lines.
Perhaps =
you can check with some neighbors, and see how their power is doing.

Date: Tuesday, May 26, 2009, 2:52 PM





Hi All,
=A0
Is there som=
eone here that can answer and electrical question for me?
=A0
During the ca=
se that I recorded those possible EVP's-there was a loud tapping noise that=
 seemed to come from the 2nd bedroom. Upon checking my logs, every time one=
 of=A0 these clicks were heard, there would be an EMF spike in the livingro=
om. The 2nd bedroom is upstairs, the livingroom downstairs. The home owners=
 have also reported that they have a touch lamp that comes on all the time =
by itself and the lights in the Kitchen will dim occasionally.
=A0
Now thes=
e taps are not consistent in timing, loudness or rhythm. Could this be the =
work of faulty breakers?
=A0
Thanks!
April

V>Silver is the best conductor known, with a conductivity of 63.01 E06 Siem=
ens per meter. Copper is next best at 59.6 E06 S/m. Gold is not the best, a=
t 45.2 E06 S/m. Aluminum is much farther down, at 37.8 E06 S/m.</DIV>
<DIV>=
 </DIV>
<DIV>Silver and gold are expensive. They are usually used=
 to plate RF assemblies where the skin effect takes place (current doe=
sn't flow uniformly through a conductor at RF frequencies but mainly travel=
s at the surface of the conductor). Gold has the advantage that i=
t never tarnishes or corrodes with most things it is exposed to. It's used =
a lot in contacts for rotary switches and relays.</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<=
DIV>Zack<BR><BR></DIV>
